title: After serial shoplifters swipe $18K in sunglasses at Faneuil Hall, police issue request for tips
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Shoplifters stole $18,000 in sunglasses from the Sunglass Hut at Faneuil Hall over seven incidents this summer.
Incidents occurred between June 7 and August 25, within a specific timeframe, targeting 40 pairs of sunglasses.
Boston Police request information on suspects, linking these thefts to a broader 15% rise in city shoplifting rates.

title: Boy, 14, shot in Brockton
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 14-year-old boy was shot in Brockton near Francis Street and Manners Avenue on Sunday evening.
The teenager was taken to a local hospital with nonlife-threatening injuries following the shooting.
Police report a silver vehicle fled the scene and are conducting an ongoing investigation.

title: Feds arrest 171 suspected members of drug cartel in New England, including 49 in Mass.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 171 suspected Sinaloa Cartel members arrested in New England, with 49 in Massachusetts, by DEA in August.
DEA seized $1.3 million, 244 kg of drugs, 22,115 pills, and 33 guns in New England operations.
DEA conducted arrests in 23 field divisions nationwide, confiscating $11 million and thousands of kg of drugs.

title: Holidays not on the “calendar”
author: Pattie Hunt Sinacole
bullets: Floating holidays allow employees to take time off for diverse cultural or personal celebrations not on the standard calendar.
Typically, employees request floating holidays in advance, requiring supervisor approval; they may be paid for full-time staff.
Companies are encouraged to approve floating holiday requests to support employee diversity and avoid staffing issues on major holidays.

title: Stefon Diggs talked about his Patriots debut, and the respect he has for Mike Vrabel
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Stefon Diggs made his Patriots debut with 57 yards in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Diggs is rehabbing from a 2024 ACL tear and considers his first game a step forward.
Diggs expressed admiration for new Patriots coach Mike Vrabel, highlighting his motivational qualities.

title: Readers: What’s your favorite spot for apple picking?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com invites readers to share favorite apple orchards to update a guide on Massachusetts apple picking.
Previous reader favorite Honey Pot Hill Orchards faces new contenders for the title in 2025.
Sunny Crest, Hollis Hills, and Red Apple Farm highlighted for offering activities and scenic experiences.

title: Photos: Highlights from Day 2 at Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston
author: Boston.com
bullets: The inaugural Seisiún Irish music festival continued on Sunday at Suffolk Downs featuring performances by The Waterboys and Glen Hansard.
Despite wet conditions, festival-goers remained enthusiastic with highlights including sets by The Pogues and The Waterboys at Suffolk Downs.
Boston.com photographer Ben Stas captured the lively atmosphere of Day 2 with photos displaying the crowd's energy and colorful sunset.

title: Mike Vrabel on Drake Maye, Will Campbell, and Bill Belichick’s comments about banning Patriots scouts
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel discussed the Patriots' season-opening loss, highlighting issues with their lack of 'complementary football.'
Vrabel criticized the pass-heavy approach with QB Drake Maye, emphasizing a need for balance and improved running game.
Vrabel addressed Bill Belichick's reported ban on Patriots scouts visiting UNC, stating 'nothing surprises me.'

title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ordered the reinstatement of Shannon O'Brien as Cannabis Control Commission chair, but the state appealed to delay it.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg accused O'Brien of misconduct and later fired her; a judge called the decision baseless.
The appeal will be decided after O'Brien's lawyers respond Wednesday; her term expires August 31, 2027.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning, according to Essex County DA.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder following the discovery of the woman's body.
The suspect is set for arraignment in Lynn District Court on Monday; names have not been released.
